intro: Tibouchina moricandiana var. vinacea, commonly known as the red-leaf tibouchina, is a striking flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red foliage and showy clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are ovate with a glossy texture, and the flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, though it can tolerate a range of growing conditions.
